arts.ttl: Mark Robins’ face said it all after Coventry City’s latest frustration
arts.sum: The fact that Jerry Yates scored only his second goal of the season was down to a blind back-pass from Jack Rudoni who handed the opportunity on a plate for the striker. At a time when City are already light on numbers, the last thing Mark Robins or the team need is to have another player missing, particularly for such an avoidable offence.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss provides injury updates on Ellis Simms and Norman Bassette ahead of Sunderland
arts.sum: Mark Robins admits he has to wait and see how his injured Coventry City strikers Ellis Simms and Norman Bassette are ahead of Saturday’s trip to Sunderland. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Paul Warne's face said it all as he issues Derby County response after fine Coventry City win
arts.sum: Paul Warne hailed Derby County's resilience after they secured their first away win of the Championship season at Coventry City. We were quite good at neutralising them, and when they scored in the 75th minute, sickly, I quite enjoyed the anarchy of it all.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss holds his hands up, making brutal admission amid 'way off-side' anger
arts.sum: Mark Robins admitted Coventry City’s below par performance against Derby County simply wasn’t good enough, and the manager says he takes full responsibilty for the result. The visitors then doubled their lead midway through the second half in controversial circumstances, with Robins and his staff insisting Yates was four yards off-side when he hit a shot that deflected off Bobby Thomas and looped up over the goalkeeper.

arts.ttl: Derby County player ratings v Coventry City as brilliant battling Rams secure first away win
arts.sum: Both sides were guilty of giving the ball away and it led to Derby's breakthrough when Jack Rudoni's back pass was seized by Yates who took it wide of Oliver Dovin and slipped it into the far corner. Coventry attempted to find a way back into the game and Ebou Adams was required to help out Nat Phillips after a miskick had almost let in Brandon Thomas-Asante.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after 2-1 home defeat to Derby County
arts.sum: City gifted the Rams the lead as early as the 11th minute when Jack Rudoni hit a poor backpass to Oliver Dovin, only for striker Jerry Yates to nip in on the loose ball, round the keeper and slot home from a tight angle. After a poor start to the second half when Derby threatened to extend their lead from a string of corners, Robins made three substitutions and switched formation to 4-2-3-1, with wide man Ephron Mason-Clark making an immediate impact down the left.

arts.ttl: Derby beat Coventry to claim first away win of the season
arts.sum: Derby earned a first away win since their return to the Championship by beating Coventry 2-1 at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Jerry Yates inspires Derby to first away win of the season
Paul Warne unleashes duo as he names Derby County team to face Coventry City
arts.sum: Nat Phillips, Dajaune Brown, Callum Elder, Kenzo Goudmijn and Liam Thompson all started the Championship clash with Nathaniel Mendez-Laing, Craig Forsyth, Joe Ward, Marcus Harness dropping to the bench and Ben Osborn missing from the squad. Derby (3-5-2): Zetterstrom; Nelson, Phillips, Cashin; Jackson, Adams, Goudmijn, Thompson, Elder; Yates and Brown.

arts.ttl: One change and fresh injury blow as Mark Robins names his Coventry City team to face Derby County
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Joel Latibeaudiere, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks; Milan van Ewijk, Josh Eccles, Ben Sheaf, Jack Rudoni; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Haji Wright. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.
